Title: Data Quality Support
Description:
We need a Consultant who can, with coaching from colleagues, help our organization with the following:


Do actual data changes in our systems regarding customer, subscription, and asset data when needed. The person to become an expert on how data is entered into our different systems, where to find data, understand dependencies what the root issue/demand is, and through that understand how to best adjust the data to create custom satisfaction, accuracy, and quality. The person will be taught and coached by employees in the team who are experts but do not have sufficient time to make the actual changes.
We might, for example, see in an analysis that we need to change several customer’s info from one setup to another to have a more efficient way of working and to do changes you need to understand each customer’s situation, which might require detective work in our systems and an understanding of impacts from changes and w solution is best fit for each customer.
Another example could be that a customer is re-organizing which creates new company setups that need to be re-in our systems (for the customers to see their services and assets accurately, and invoices correctly). The person we are looking for would then be the person who understands how to do this and can perform actual change.
Be a person who can work with services and billing support cases
Example cases are that a customer wants to make a change in their service subscription or has received an inaccurate work then contains identifying and understanding the issue, finding a solution together with the customer, and making the solution happen. If a pattern can be identified then the person could also be a part of a business development act. A person who can help in testing of new IT developments and implementations locally. This is a functionality test focused on ensuring accuracy in our data and ensuring that input and extraction of our service, billing, and customer are done accurately and efficiently.


Requirements


All of the above requires a person who is structured, meticulous, has an eye for details and data quality, and can work independently, which requires a higher degree of logical thinking. The person should also not be afraid to align issues and solutions with customers and employees when needed, clear communication and being able to explain pedagogically are important.
The person is required to have good knowledge of common Microsoft Office tools, especially Excel, where this person should know how to use more complicated formulas (macro is not required).
It’s a plus (not a must) if the person has experience in system or software testing.


Skills:


Data Analysis
Excel
Data Quality
Microsoft Office


Education: What we search for is someone who has a good level of logical thinking and is capable of learning new things in a fa accurate way - a relevant University degree is an indicator of this, but not an absolute requirement.

Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than 400 million active users per month.

Experience working with orchestration tool (ex: Airflow)
Experience working with a large data set
Experience building complex ETL pipelines
Experience working with cloud providers such as GCP, AWS, or Azure
Strong programming skills in Spark with Scala and Python

Strong understanding of Software Engineering practices and principles
Excellent problem-solving and communication skills
Self-motivated and have a proven ability to take initiative to own the problems that come up and solve them

Maintaining and improving the ingestion pipeline to reliably deliver billions of events daily in defined SLA
Provide support for all teams in building and optimizing their complex pipelines
Work closely with other teams to identify pain points and problems around the platform
Develop new tools and frameworks to improve the data platform
Facilitate company-wide to be data-driven
Work in close collaboration with data scientists and data analysts to help support their work in production
Work with vast projects such as building an ML platform and streaming use cases
Setup best practices and processes around software and data development


It would be great if you also have


Working with messaging systems like Kafka
Knowledge in Kubernetes
Hands-on experience with any streaming platform
Experience managing data warehouse in BigQuery or Redshift

A smart, talented, and agile team: An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
A great compensation package: Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Om BST Group 

BST Group är marknadsledande inom brandskydd i Norden. Vårt omfattande nätverk förenar över 700 medarbetare i 19 bolag från fyra länder som är specialiserade på att leverera brandsäkerhetslösningar i världsklass, med starkt fokus på teknisk innovation och hållbarhet. Genom vårt samarbete över nationsgränserna kan vi effektivisera och förbättra säkerheten i samhället, samtidigt som vi bidrar till en mer hållbar framtid. Vi är stolta över att leda utvecklingen inom brandskydd, utmana befintliga standarder och sätta nya regler som garanterar tryggare samhällen och en säkrare infrastruktur. 

Läs mer på bstgroupab.com 




 

Dina arbetsuppgifter: 




Hos oss kommer du att arbeta med utveckling och underhåll av vår dataplattform, samt stödja verksamheten genom att säkerställa att rätt data är tillgänglig för beslutsfattande och analys. Du kommer att använda Azure Data Lake för att garantera skalbar och flexibel lagring samt med hjälp av Databricks optimera våra pipelines och lyfta data till molnet. För att transformera och modellera data används dbt Cloud. 




Du kommer att hantera utmaningar kring inkrementell dataingestion från system vi integrerar, samt optimera och genomföra datatransformationer. En del av ditt arbete innebär också att felsöka bristande indata och skapa tester som säkerställer datakvaliteten. Vi har automatiserade arbetsflöden som dagligen kör hela pipelinen, från rådata från källsystem till transformationer, modellering och uppdaterade rapporter, och dessa kommer du underhålla och vidareutveckla. 

Tjänsten är placerad i Hägersten, men det finns möjlighet till distansarbete en del av arbetstiden om så önskas. 




 




Varför är din roll viktig? 

Hos oss får du möjlighet att lösa komplexa problem som är centrala för vår verksamhetsutveckling. Den data du hjälper till att förädla kommer, med start efter årsskiftet, även användas för att mäta vår klimatpåverkan och hållbarhet inom hela koncernen.  




Du kommer att ha stor frihet i ditt skapande, utan långa beslutsvägar, och du får ansvar för allt från planering till implementering av nya initiativ. Tillsammans med vår controller Kristian kan du bolla idéer för att sedan realisera de projekt ni tillsammans sätter, där du står för den datatekniska kunskapen, vilket ställer höga krav på din självständighet och ditt driv. Vi har som mål att utveckla vårt datadrivna arbetssätt och i framtiden implementera dataanalyser med hjälp av ML/AI, där du också kommer att spela en viktig roll. 




 

Teknik & kvalifikationer 




Vi ser programmering som ett hantverk som kan tillämpas över olika programmeringsspråk och plattformar. För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du ha goda erfarenheter av Python och SQL. Du har även praktisk erfarenhet av ETL-processer och molnplattformar, särskilt Microsoft Azure. Det är meriterande att ha arbetat med Databricks, dbt Cloud, Power BI och AI/ML men inte ett måste. Vi letar efter dig som har ett stort tekniskt intresse och därför lär dig snabbt.  




Vi tror du har 1-3 års arbetslivserfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller liknande. Du har en universitetsutbildning inom relevant område och är analytiskt lagd med starkt intresse för datahantering. 

 




 




Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Du kommer att använda Azure Data Lake för att garantera skalbar och flexibel lagring samt med hjälp av Databricks optimera våra pipelines och lyfta data till molnet. För att transformera och modellera data används dbt Cloud. 


Du kommer att hantera utmaningar kring inkrementell dataingestion från system vi integrerar, samt optimera och genomföra datatransformationer. En del av ditt arbete innebär också att felsöka bristande indata och skapa tester som säkerställer datakvaliteten. Vi har automatiserade arbetsflöden som dagligen kör hela pipelinen, från rådata från källsystem till transformationer, modellering och uppdaterade rapporter, och dessa kommer du underhålla och vidareutveckla. 

Tjänsten är placerad i Hägersten, men det finns möjlighet till distansarbete en del av arbetstiden om så önskas. 


 


Varför är din roll viktig? 

Hos oss får du möjlighet att lösa komplexa problem som är centrala för vår verksamhetsutveckling. Den data du hjälper till att förädla kommer, med start efter årsskiftet, även användas för att mäta vår klimatpåverkan och hållbarhet inom hela koncernen.  


Du kommer att ha stor frihet i ditt skapande, utan långa beslutsvägar, och du får ansvar för allt från planering till implementering av nya initiativ. Tillsammans med vår controller Kristian kan du bolla idéer för att sedan realisera de projekt ni tillsammans sätter, där du står för den datatekniska kunskapen, vilket ställer höga krav på din självständighet och ditt driv. Vi har som mål att utveckla vårt datadrivna arbetssätt och i framtiden implementera dataanalyser med hjälp av ML/AI, där du också kommer att spela en viktig roll. 


 

Teknik & kvalifikationer 


Vi ser programmering som ett hantverk som kan tillämpas över olika programmeringsspråk och plattformar. För att lyckas i denna roll behöver du ha goda erfarenheter av Python och SQL. Du har även praktisk erfarenhet av ETL-processer och molnplattformar, särskilt Microsoft Azure. Det är meriterande att ha arbetat med Databricks, dbt Cloud, Power BI och AI/ML men inte ett måste. Vi letar efter dig som har ett stort tekniskt intresse och därför lär dig snabbt.  


Vi tror du har 1-3 års arbetslivserfarenhet som Data Engineer, Data Scientist eller liknande. Du har en universitetsutbildning inom relevant område och är analytiskt lagd med starkt intresse för datahantering. 

 


 


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

Apply your expertise in statistics and data analysis to enhance data quality and the effectiveness of our AI algorithms.
Monitor data pipelines and systems performance, troubleshoot data issues, and implement optimizations.
Stay updated with the latest technologies and methodologies in data engineering and sports analytics to continuously improve our data systems.



Qualifications:



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering, with a strong proficiency in Python.
Extensive experience with AWS services (e.g., S3, EC2, RDS, Lambda, Redshift) and managing cloud-based data infrastructure.
Solid understanding of data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing principles.
Experience with real-time data processing and streaming technologies is highly desirable.
A good eye for statistics and experience in statistical modeling or analysis.
Passion for sports and sports data analysis is a big plus.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.



Why Join Us:



Be part of a cutting-edge project that's shaping the future of sports betting.
Work in an environment that values innovation, collaboration, and a data-driven approach.
Enjoy a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and flexible working arrangements.
Engage in continuous learning and growth opportunities within an ambitious tech startup.



How to Apply:

Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, and any relevant portfolio links or GitHub repository to us. Please include "Data Engineer Application" in the subject line.

We're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.

We are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join Kambi’s Data Platform stream to support us in building a decentralized and self-serviced data platform, contributing to our Data Mesh journey. We believe in the high importance of data in every organization, and we are committed to empowering Kambi’s businesses through our solution.

The Role And Responsibilities

As a Data Engineer, you will help shape our data platform by connecting modern data mesh principles with the practical aspects of our current warehousing solution.

You will initially join the Data Warehouse team, however as we move forward with next delivered data products you may find yourself to work in smaller, cross-functional teams with Data Engineers and Analytics Engineers, focusing on a particular area of our unified data platform.

We believe that you have valuable experience in data modelling and transformations, which will help you understand business requirements and how they translate into data models. Experience with dbt or other modern tools will be beneficial.

As we aim to shift from Data Warehouse towards Lakehouse concept, we expect that you will be familiar with CI/CD and cloud infrastructure solutions appropriate for data platform. At Kambi we work with AWS tools, we use Airflow for orchestration, and we have recently rebuilt our Data Lake with the use of Iceberg and Trino.

Languages that we are looking for are Python and SQL for your daily work, and English for communication with your colleagues.

Is Kambi a place for you?

We highly value soft skills such as collaboration, communication, and problem-solving abilities. Our teams have a high level of autonomy in decisions around solutions and ways of working. You will thrive in this role if you are curious, enjoy technical discussions with your team and willing to collaborate to find the most suitable solution.

We offer friendly, welcoming, and inclusive working culture in an international work environment. We value learning and development, both on an individual level and as a whole organization. It is important for us that we grow together. We like to have fun with our colleagues, but we also understand that each employee needs their flexibility to thrive.

And one last thing...

We would be happy if you tick off all our boxes, yet we also believe it is just as important we tick off all of yours. And if you think you have most of what we are looking for, but not every single thing, go ahead and hit apply. We would still love to hear from you!

We want a balance between office work and working from home. We believe we will all gain from the best of both worlds, so the way of working in Kambi is hybrid – we want to have a chance to work with you in our Stockholm office 2 days in a week.

Som en viktig del av vår kunds Data & Analytics-team där du kommer arbeta med en av Sveriges största databaser och bidra till den pågående resan mot molnet (GCP). Här får du möjlighet att växa och dela din kunskap och vara med och forma ett datadrivet arbetssätt i ett innovativt och föränderligt företag.

Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden

  • Definiera behov, samla in, bearbeta och modellera data.
  • Arbeta med hela värdekedjan inom analys.
  • Kommunicera och visualisera resultat.

Kravprofil

  • Erfarenhet av SQL-utveckling.
  • Erfarenhet av Tableau eller liknande visualiseringsverktyg.
  • Meriterande: Erfarenhet av GCP, DBT, GitHub, BigQuery, Looker Studio och Connected Sheets.
  • Minst 5 års relevant erfarenhet.
  • Flytande i både svenska och engelska.

Personliga egenskaper

  • Affärsmässig och ansvarstagande.
  • Förmåga att arbeta både detaljorienterat och i ett helikopterperspektiv.
  • Inspirerande och coachande med passion för data.

Om du vill vara med och driva förändring och utveckling i en dynamisk miljö, ser vi fram emot din ansökan

Vi har Nordens största utbud av erfarna digitala marknadsförare

Vi hjälper kunder som vill utveckla sina digitala kanaler, har ett föränderligt kompetensbehov samt söker 100% flexibla, skalbara och kostnadseffektiva lösningar som de själva kan styra över.

Title: Business / Data Analyst with Product Owner experience, Group Credit Management
Description:
Job ID: 26367  

Would you like to be part of a Nordic team, developing the future credit processes for our customers? We are now looking for an experienced Business / Data Analyst with Product Owner experience to our High Risk Data & Default Management Team.

 

We are offering you an exciting opportunity to develop key capabilities at the heart of Nordea. Your work will require to understand the connection between business processes, data and the respective IT set-up to pro-actively solve complex problems connected to Nordea’s Credit Risk process.

 

About this opportunity

 

Welcome to the High Risk Capability team. We are a growing team, driving the development for high risk credit processes (such as default management and early warnings). Our aim is to build sustainable processes and supporting tools that cater for automation through which we enable great customer experiences. You will work closely with team members and relevant stakeholders to drive the implementation of new solutions and processes for business and regulatory requirements.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Structuring and driving analysis and initiatives from initiation to successful delivery in close collaboration with management and stakeholders
Be part of an agile structure, with focus on defining, prioritizing and driving features working closely with development teams and relevant stakeholders
Ensuring our solutions meet business and regulatory requirements and maximize business value
Building expertise of Nordea’s credit risk agenda especially on High Risk; including understanding of regulatory requirements affecting Credit Risk including the systems and data flows
Identifying and actively proposing improvements to streamline the end to end credit processes and enable automation in the area

 

You’ll join a diverse, multi-faceted and passionate team. Occasional travel primarily in the Nordics should be expected. The location is preferably in Sweden or Finland.

 

Who you are

 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

 

Your experience and background:

At least 3 years of experience working with regulations / data / business processes within Banking, preferably within Credit Risk
Experience in driving change (from gathering business requirements to implementation), in an agile environment
Comfortable working independently with data analysis (i.e. in SQL)
Have a professional level of English, both written and spoken
Have excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, building strong relationships with stakeholders across Business and IT

 

To succeed in the role, we believe that you:

Can effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment
Are self-going with a  natural “can do” attitude, show ability learn quickly and have a solution-oriented mindset supported by structured, analytical and creative thinking
Strong in documenting and conceptualising requirements in complex environments 

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 15/10/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Matthew Woodward.

Description:
Arbetsuppgifter


Utveckla vår framtida plattform inom Data and Analytic
Påverka arkitektur, teknikval och processer
Bygga kvalitativa högpresterande datapipelines


Är du nyfiken på hur den här texten ska sluta? Kul! Vi gillar dig redan. Att vara nyfiken är viktigt för oss.

På SBAB spelar nämligen rollen mindre roll. Att du är kunnig förväntar vi oss. Det viktiga är att du vill vara med och bidra till vår kultur, attityd och vårt sätt att vara. Och eftersom vi är lika många experter som medarbetare, behöver alla vara just nyfikna och intresserade av varandras olikheter. Vi lyssnar in och omvärderar kontinuerligt. Vi tror på mångfald, att olika perspektiv berikar och att du är en viktig framgångsfaktor. Fortfarande nyfiken? Välkommen!

Att jobba som Data engineer

SBAB söker en Data Engineer som tycker om att koda i Python och har ett stort intresse för dataflöden och automatisering. Du trivs med att utveckla högkvalitativ och högpresterande kod med återanvändbara komponenter. Du tycker om det agila arbetssättet och gillar att arbeta tillsammans genom MOB- eller parprogrammering.

Du kommer att jobba på Data Science-avdelningen på SBAB och höra hemma i ett av avdelningens flera agila och prestigelösa team. Vi har en hybridlösning för vårt analysdata där vi jobbar både med cloud- och on-prem-miljöer med en hög grad av automatisering och DevOps-funktionalitet. Vi har en teknisk roadmap och en vision som vi vill ha din hjälp att utveckla och nå.

Blir du glad av att jobba med följande kommer du att trivas:


Python och SQL
Data-lagring (t.ex.i en Delta-lake)
Pipelines från t.ex. Kafka, API, externa- och tabulära källor
Hackdays


Har du även erfarenhet eller intresse av data virtualisering eller har du redan varit i kontakt med mikrotjänster, så är det en bonus. Du är en orädd person som gillar att experimentera och ta initiativ utanför din hemmaarena. Du bör vara flexibel när det kommer till verktyg, och vara öppen för att använda de komponenter som passar det specifika uppdraget. Vi ser gärna att du kan kommunicera väl på svenska i tal och skrift.

Har du check på allt?


Nyfiken
Lagspelare
Högt engagemang
Självdrivande
Målmedveten


Annars då?

Gillar du oss, och tror att du kan bidra, är vårt tips att inte vänta för länge med att skicka in CV eller LinkedIn-profil. Har du andra idéer på hur du kan visa vem du är? Spännande! Hur du än ansöker så ser vi fram emot att lära känna dig mer.

Title: Complex Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job ID: 25962 

 

Would you like to lead and execute a wide variety of complex investigations dealing with money laundering, terrorist ﬁnancing, sanctions circumventions and other ﬁnancial crimes prevention to support multiple business areas and risk functions? We are now looking for professionals to join our Financial Crime Investigation, Intelligence & Analytics (FCIIA) team.

 

At Nordea, we know our customers’ needs are changing – and we’re deeply committed to meeting them with the ﬁnancial solutions of tomorrow. We’re creating an agile environment where we’re harnessing the power of technology – one where you can make an impact. So bring your skills, ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll ﬁnd plenty of opportunities to grow and make your mark on something bigger.

 

About this opportunity

 

You´ll join Group Financial Crime Prevention, where we assess, mitigate and prevent the key ﬁnancial crime threats Nordea faces now and in the future. We also help transforming Nordea’s ﬁnancial crime function into a proactive and intelligence led capability by combining the disciplines of intelligence and data analytics.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Leverage your programming/science knowledge to process big data and support building FCIIA’s defense against Financial Crime
Execute and lead multi-jurisdictional complex investigations and identify threat network and  impact on the bank & industry
Apply econometrics to develop statistical methods & models to enhance assessment of risk to highlight concerns, threats and potential scale
Drive and support co-ordination exercises with other risk functions to mitigate the ﬁnancial crime risks
Support various development initiatives to enhance threat detection and help present updates for senior management team
Integrate and visualize existing models in tools such as Qlik

 

The role is based in Stockholm, Helsinki, Tallinn or Warsaw. Welcome to a team that strive to be build capabilities and aspire being the best-in-industry for ﬁnancial crime risk management.

 

Who you are

 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.

 

Your proﬁle and background:

Strong analytic background with ability to combine quantitative analysis with AML/CTF. Specialist knowledge of SQL, Qlik, R, Matlab, Python and/or other analytical tools
A working knowledge of AML/sanctions function that consumes business data to identify ﬁnancial crime concerns
The ability to drill down and understand key/critical data elements, where and how they are used within AML using analytic tools
Work with wider team and stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging internal and  external data using advanced techniques to identify and develop methods to detect money laundering and threat ﬁnancing
Analyze, prepare, present and interpret reporting or research results with all levels of  management in a fast-paced developing environment
Strong research and investigation skills with high proﬁciency in English

Make business recommendations with effective presentations of ﬁndings at various levels of stakeholders through visual displays of quantitative and qualitative information

Design or provide support for implementation of strategic intelligence development tool sets though business system testing, UAT and post-implementation approach and test cases.

Ensure appropriate governance over intelligence development process and maintenance of audit trail over detection and remediation exercises

Train peer analysts on qualitative and quantitative structured analytic techniques and tools used to create intelligence deliverables and assessments

 

Nice to have:

ICA or ACAMs certiﬁcation
Experience in handling and working with large data sets 
Presentation of high-quality investigation reports

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 09/10/2024. For more information, you’re welcome to contact Christoffer Paulsson

Title: Graduate and Junior Management Consulting Analysts to Accenture Consulting
Description:
Are you a recent graduate or about to graduate from university? Do you see a future career in Consulting? Bring your talent and passion to Accenture and help us deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity! Take this opportunity as a Consulting Analyst to develop your skills and build an extraordinary career!

About Accenture And Consulting 

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services and solutions in strategy, consulting, digital, technology and operations. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With more than 710,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology. 

About Our Functions And Industries

Accenture Consulting consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups. Main functions for Consulting Analysts include Finance, Supply Chain, HR and Technology. Primary industries include Retail, Consumer Goods & Services, Banking, Insurance, Capital Markets, Comms & Media, Utilities, Industrial Equipment, Automotive, Health. Read more about our business functions and industries here.   

 

Consulting Analysts within Industry and Functional Consulting Industry and Functional Consulting leverage industry and functional expertise and data-driven insights to advise, design and implement transformational solutions to reimagine business functions and create new business models for our clients. As a Consulting Analyst, you’ll work as part of a project team to build enduring, trust-based relationships and work with clients to identify market opportunities that transform their businesses across people, process and technology. You’ll get early responsibility and build your skills and expertise through interesting and challenging work.

Work you will do as a Consulting Analyst



Apply insights and knowledge to help clients navigate in a changing business environment, optimize their business and leverage their talent 


Help clients identify and unlock value in their business using benchmarks, interviews and workshops  


Design and implement end-to-end business processes to transform our clients’ business  


Define client needs by identifying and documenting business requirements, before agreeing what needs to change and which opportunities to take advantage of 


Define how the client will evolve to the future state— i.e., the impact of the changes and the steps we will take to help the leaders, employees, customers and others adapt quickly to new ways of working. 



 

What’s in it for you:  



Great development opportunities to start building your professional career 


Extensive training to develop your business acumen, technical and professional skills including on-the-job learning and formal training  


Access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization - including methodology, knowledge databases, expert networks and benchmarks 


A dedicated mentor to guide you in your career at Accenture 


Inspiring colleagues to support you in your daily work 


Over time, you will also have leadership responsibilities and lead teams



Job Qualifications

Who we are looking for:  



You have a master's degree and / or will receive your degree within one year of applying 


You can start at Accenture in late summer/autumn 2025  


You have proven strong academic results in a relevant field 


You are an analytical problem-solver with strong business acumen 


You are ambitious, driven, solution-oriented and eager to start your career in an advisory role 


You have excellent written and oral presentation skills


You are fluent in English. Swedish is beneficial but not required 



Office and start

We are looking for graduates to join our offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö in late summer/autumn 2025. Mobility and flexibility to either work physically at an office (client or Accenture), or in a virtual “home office” is expected. This requires you to both have a high degree of flexibility for travelling to our clients or working with international teams virtually. The application and interview process 

Send your application today through our application portal and attach:



CV


Cover Letter


University Transcripts/grades (including GPA in a 5 grade scale)



Upload all files under "Upload Resume/CV". Please note that all of these documents are required for a complete application. Only complete applications are reviewed.  

Please indicate which office(s) you are applying to in your application.   The screening and selection process is ongoing. If your application proceeds to the next step, you will receive an invitation to two tests that aim to measure your analytical ability.  We look forward to receiving your application!  Equal is greater than - Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries and all business functions — underpinned by the world’s largest delivery network — Accenture works at the intersection of business and technology to help clients improve their performance and create sustainable value for their stakeholders. With more than 710,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture drives innovation to improve the way the world works and lives.

Through deep industry expertise, analytics and insights, we empower clients to survive and thrive in the new, the now and the unknown. To stay agile in a world dominated by change, the C-suite must keep the core business running while simultaneously identifying and investing in the new. Accenture Consulting enables leaders to act quickly and confidently as they pivot to the future. Known for our ability to execute at speed, we help clients determine clear, actionable paths to competitive agility by bringing them new thinking on business and technology. 

About Our Functions And Industries

Accenture Consulting consists of a wide range of business functions and industry groups. Main functions for Consulting Analysts include Finance, Supply Chain, HR and Technology. Primary industries include Retail, Consumer Goods & Services, Banking, Insurance, Capital Markets, Comms & Media, Utilities, Industrial Equipment, Automotive, Health. Read more about our business functions and industries here.   

 

Consulting Analysts within Industry and Functional Consulting Industry and Functional Consulting leverage industry and functional expertise and data-driven insights to advise, design and implement transformational solutions to reimagine business functions and create new business models for our clients. As a Consulting Analyst, you’ll work as part of a project team to build enduring, trust-based relationships and work with clients to identify market opportunities that transform their businesses across people, process and technology. You’ll get early responsibility and build your skills and expertise through interesting and challenging work.

Work you will do as a Consulting Analyst


  • Apply insights and knowledge to help clients navigate in a changing business environment, optimize their business and leverage their talent 

  • Help clients identify and unlock value in their business using benchmarks, interviews and workshops  

  • Design and implement end-to-end business processes to transform our clients’ business  

  • Define client needs by identifying and documenting business requirements, before agreeing what needs to change and which opportunities to take advantage of 

  • Define how the client will evolve to the future state— i.e., the impact of the changes and the steps we will take to help the leaders, employees, customers and others adapt quickly to new ways of working.

Title: CRM Analytics & Optimisation Specialist
Description:
TUI is evolving its customer marketing to be individually relevant, using customer history, propensity and real-time data.

Now is an excellent time to join our team as we advance to highly personalised, data-driven campaigns. As a CRM Analytics & Optimisation Specialist, you will deliver insights that drive key decisions for our automated campaigns. You'll analyse customer and campaign data to generate valuable insights, identifying opportunities to enhance consumer understanding, engagement, sales, and experience. Additionally, you will establish a testing framework to optimise our real-time marketing campaigns powered by Braze.

This role can be based in either our Luton, Hannover, Rijswijk, Oostende or Stockholm office. Closing date for applications will be the 16th October.

About Our Offer


Personal benefits: Attractive remuneration, discretionary bonus schemes, generous travel benefits, extensive health & well-being support, and more.
Flexible working: Work is something you do, not some where you go. Our team meet in the Luton office once a week
A career to shape: Access the TUI Learning Hub to level-up and reach your ambitions.
Broaden your network: We champion intercultural collaboration and provide opportunities to work on global projects and teams
Community: Get involved with incredible local charity and sustainability initiatives like the TUI Care Foundation.



About The Job

Your key areas of responsibility and accountability will focus on delivering insights and campaign production:

Campaign and audience analytics


Conduct in-depth analyses of customer data and CRM channel performance, utilizing statistical methods to inform and optimize CRM strategies.
Useestablished analytical techniques to generate data insights and translate these into clear business stories that drive action.
You will have a deep understanding of campaign metrics, understanding of channel mix and audience optimization, which includes statistical knowledge and testing techniques.
You will be the linking pin between the Group CRM Centre of Excellence team and the Group Analytics team to ensure the proper methodologies are used and information and insight are shared.



Campaign optimisation design


Work together with Group Analytics to define A/B testing methodologies, conduct multivariate tests, and translate data insights into actionable marketing optimizations.
Designs more advanced campaign optimisations and campaign tests for all of the Centre of Excellences and makes recommendations for improvements to campaigns.
Works with the Centre of Excellence team to input into and translate campaign briefs into campaign tests in Braze canvases and templates
Ensures exploring audience size for marketing automations is optimised by effective selections, appropriate suppressions and intelligent defaults to ensure relevant customers are not omitted.
Work with our Platform and Group Analytics team to ensure that all data requirements are defined and understood to support the delivery and evaluation of each campaign and test.



CRM campaign optimisation production support


Supporting the design & build of campaigns for the optimization and tests executed across different customer lifecycles. Ensuring they are built in the most efficient way to demonstrate test hypothesis or uplifts.
Become an expert in the capabilities and features of Braze on campaign testing and optimisations, so you leverage the full power of the platform in the automations you build.



About You


Proven experience in similar analytical and or campaign optimisation roles
Strong statistical knowledge and demonstrable analytical problem solving capabilities
Good technical knowledge of marketing platforms, and good knowledge of relevant coding languages (SQL, Phython, R, Liquid script etc.)
Nice to have: experience with implementing multichannel marketing communications through industry-leading technology (ideally Braze but also Salesforce, Adobe, EMarsys, IBM etc.)
Comfortable working in a large pan European business, where some travel will be required.
Fluent in English, ability in other languages desirable but not essential (German, French or Dutch)
Strong problem solving capabilities, organisation skills and very logical train of thought
Excellent communication and organisational skills
Excellent attention to detail
Flexible approach to working within a fast-changing environment



From a workplace to a place to belong. At TUI we embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion, encouraging everyone to come as you are, because together, our potential is limitless.

We are committed to supporting candidates with disabilities and impairments so if you require any support, please do let us know.

Title: Business Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Business Intelligence Consultant - Specialised in cloud based platforms




Nigel Frank are partnered with a leading BI consultancy who continuously keep an eye on the market for skilled consultants who are interested in delivering an entire data project to their customer, not just working on a small section.




They were founded by highly experienced consultants (each with 20+ years of experience) who felt as though the larger consultancies they worked with, didn't deliver what the customer actually needed; a tailored and thorough data delivery.




Their consultants work with the customer to thoroughly understand their need, consulting on what would be the best route and then build and deliver that with a team of highly-skilled consultants. They will then continue to work with these companies to ensure the platforms are being used to their highest potential and often these projects can take up to two years.




If you're somebody who's either feeling the same as their founders and want to explore a more consultative environment, or you want to step into a consulting role as you feel ready to work with interesting projects that will challenge you to progress in your career, this could be a great option for you.




What can you look forward to?

Hybrid policy with an encouraged 2-3 days in their Stockholm office
Your choice of laptop and set-up
With over 30 customers who consistently work with them they have interesting projects in various industries Logistics, Transport, Manufacturing, Automotive and Retail
Competitive remuneration package: high base salaries, collective bonus, you specify your pension level and over 30 days' vacation
Monthly catch-ups with your manager to make sure you’re happy with your work and on the right path to reach your goals
A fantastic team and culture which is friendly and supportive
Highly senior team that supports knowledge sharing and progression
Time and budget devoted to training and development
Team trips abroad and in Sweden throughout the year




Their technology stack includes Azure BI and Data stack inc. Data Factory, Databricks, Synapse, etc., GCP, AWS, Power BI and some Tableau. They are now also working with customer that are encouraging more Data Science methods.




If you want to develop within the most prominent data platforms and join a team of colleagues who encourage knowledge sharing and progression, take a look at the requirements below.




What we need from you

At least 2 years of BI or data engineering experience: building data pipelines, modelling, cleansing, transformation, data warehousing, etc.
Proficiency in a cloud platform: Azure, GCP or AWS
Skilled in working with databases, both on prem and cloud: Snowflake, SQL, Postgres, etc.
A desire to learn more and keep on up-skilling – current consultants are building their experience in advanced analytics (AI/ML) and project leadership
Strong communication demonstrated through managing and engaging stakeholders and eliciting requirements effectively
Analytical and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team – you will be working alongside your skilled colleagues while also taking the initiative
Experience with visualisation and tools such as Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc.
Fluency in Swedish is required




This is an established company that has a fantastic reputation and since they prioritise having a great culture and working environment, you can expect to be surrounded by the latest tech and very best consultants; offering you a great chance to continue to grow your skill set.




As a consultant, no two days will be the same, really giving you an opportunity to propel your career forward.




If you find this opportunity interesting, apply and we can run through the details. Alternatively, if you have any questions, drop me a message on LinkedIn or give me a call: +46 77 588 86 15

Title: Data Engineer with interest in Fraud Prevention | SEB, Solna
Description:
SEB is more than just a bank with an IT function. We are a progressive tech company powered by innovation and fueled by collaboration. From COBOL to AI and everything in between, we offer you an impressive tech stack and several technology paths. Together we're innovating for a sustainable society and building the tech arena of the future, a welcoming space for everyone. Are you ready to take on a new challenge? If so, you'll be interested in this opportunity!

Would you be interested in working with a skilled team of Data Engineering and Java developers who are responsible for delivering monitoring solutions for SEB?

We are currently looking for an experienced Data engineer to join us on this important journey!

About The Role

As a Data Engineer in the Financial Crime Prevention team you will be responsible for developing and maintaining new technical capabilities in a smart way to allow us to detect bad actors. Our technical environment consists of but is not limited to Java, Scala, Python, Hadoop, Kafka, Spark, Kubernetes and Elastic Search. Here you will have a chance to make a difference and work with challenging tasks. You will have great opportunities to both develop and take further steps in your career working within a highly collaborative environment.

You will work in an environment with multiple Agile teams across Sweden and the Baltic states.

To thrive in this role, we believe you have:


Experience in Java programming language
Experience in Scala/Python, Spark, Hadoop, Kafka, SQL
Experience in cloud platforms, such as Google Cloud Platform, Azure or AWS.
Experience in DevOps and Terraform is considered an advantage.
Analytical mindset and ability to solve complex technical problems.
Passion for challenges to drive your personal development and professional growth.
Being a team player open for growth and learning is crucially important for the role.


What we offer:


Agile and modern ways of working
A flat hierarchy and openness to share ideas, opinions and points of views
Remote working possibilities and flexible work schedule


Ready to join?

Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 11th of October 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Agnes Kemper at agnes.kemper@seb.se. Please note that we are not able to handle applications via email due to GDPR.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Learn more about working at SEB here : www.sebgroup.com/career

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
We are expanding our global team and looking for an experienced Business Intelligence Developer. Are you passionate about data-driven solutions and want to play a key role in developing our business? Keep reading!




Position Overview

We are seeking a talented and motivated Business Intelligence Developer to join our dynamic team. As a Business Intelligence Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining robust BI solutions that enable data-driven decision-making across our global organization. You will work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand business requirements, design efficient data models, and develop insightful dashboards and reports.




Key responsibilities

Design, develop, and optimize data pipelines and ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our business intelligence environment.
Build and maintain robust data models and data structures to support reporting, analytics, and business intelligence initiatives.
Optimize BI solutions for performance and usability, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.
Provide technical support and troubleshooting for BI applications and data-related issues.
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in business intelligence and data analytics.




Requirements

Strong understanding of data warehousing concepts and hands-on experience in data modeling techniques specifically within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and loading processes.
Experience with Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address data quality issues, discrepancies, or gaps.
Understanding of business processes and requirements across different functional areas.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively in a global, cross-functional team environment.
Ability to create clear and concise documentation for BI solutions, reports, and dashboards.
You are fluent in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.




We expect our employees to actively manage their own success. That means asking questions, sharing and expanding knowledge, interests and ideas and contributing to a constructive and kind work environment.




Location

Location is primarily Stockholm. The right skills are most important, and we can therefore also consider locations in Borlänge or Oslo.




Your application

We work with ongoing selection, so send your application as soon as possible.




Questions

If you have additional questions about the position, please contact Martin Willén, Global Head of Business Control on +46 243 785 51 or Lars Vrennhage, HR Operations, on +46 8 704 80 39.




About Symetri

At Symetri we create and provide technology solutions and services for design, engineering, construction and manufacturing businesses. We empower people to work smarter for a better future by ensuring they have access to the expertise and technology they need to improve their performance and sustainability.

We develop and distribute our own solutions and are one of the world’s top resellers of Autodesk software with over 400K users across Northern Europe and the US. Our mission is to challenge people to work smarter for a better future, and we value passion, teamwork, courage and the drive to create change above all else.

Title: Forskningsingenjör i teoretisk kemi
Description:
Arbetsuppgifter

Implementering av automatiseras setup av free energy perturbation och empirical valence bond simuleringar, speciellt inriktat mot katalytiska system i gränskikt mellan elektrod och elektrolyt. Vi kommer att använda Python tillsammans med programvarorna VeloxChem, Gromacs och OpenMM för att enkelt kunna studera komplexa system. Målet är att ha en öppet tillgänglig programvara vid projekttidens slut, som kan användas av personer med liten eller ingen programmeringserfarenhet för att simulera elektrokatalytiska reaktioner.

En anställning på ett ledande tekniskt universitet som skapar kunskap och kompetens för en hållbar framtid
Engagerade och ambitiösa kollegor samt en kreativ, internationell och dynamisk miljö
Stark koppling mellan programvaruutveckling och tillämpningsnära forskning.

Krav


Avlagd examen på grundnivå eller avancerad nivå (högskoleutbildning) inom ämnet för anställningen eller motsvarande kompetens.
Erfarenhet av simuleringar med kvantkemisk och molekyldynamisk programvara

Vi ser gärna att du har god kunskap inom katalyssimuleringar, med erfarenhet av både kvantkemisk och molekyldynamisk programvara
Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av programmering i Python.

CV inklusive relevant yrkeserfarenhet och kunskap.
Kopia av examensbevis och betyg från dina tidigare universitetsstudier. Översättningar till engelska eller svenska om de ursprungliga dokumenten inte utfärdas på något av dessa språk.
Personligt brev, max 1 sida långt

Anställningen gäller tidsbegränsat enligt avtal - i upp till 12 mån, tillträde enligt överenskommelse.

Strävan efter jämställdhet, mångfald och lika villkor är både en kvalitetsfråga och en självklar del av KTH:s värdegrund.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer- Acceleration Nordics
Description:
Welcome to join an experienced and growing team of BI Developers, Data scientists and Consultants who work to drive increased marketing effectiveness for some of Sweden's and the world's largest brands.

As part of the leading media agency group GroupM, we at Acceleration work to transform large amounts of data into solutions to complex problems in media and marketing. The projects include a broad mix of econometrics, media buying algorithms, dashboards and strategy projects/consulting services.

Acceleration drives GroupM and the rest of the industry forward through technology and data innovation and works closely with the largest advertisers, publishers and technology companies in the industry. This is a position with a plethora of opportunities for growth both professionally and personally.

About The Position

In this role, you will be responsible for the operation and development of our Business Intelligence solutions as part of our Swedish Business Intelligence Team. This includes self-service analytics, data engineering, data platforms, and data visualization. Your primary responsibilities will be to manage the development of data models, dashboards, and technical solutions for data pipelines. You will also work on automating data processes for our clients and internal projects.

In addition to the above, we are looking for someone who:


Has strong analytical skills and are detail oriented
Has experience and a passion for data visualization and presentation.
Has worked with Power BI (or other visualization tool)
Enjoys working with BI, SQL, databases, and ELT/ETL processes, considering them your home turf.
Holds at least a bachelor's degree relevant to BI/Analytics and preferably has work experience in the field.
Has excellent communication and presentation skills.
It's a plus if you know Python or another scripting language and have an interest in learning more about statistics and data science.


Our offer

With us, you get the opportunity to work with many of Sweden's and the world's most ambitious brands, together with a team that is passionate about digital marketing, and with market-leading technologies.

You will sit in central premises on Birger Jarlsgatan with inspiring colleagues from different backgrounds, who together drive digital marketing to the next level through innovation and solid work. Furthermore, there are great opportunities for personal development and career development within GroupM Sweden, as well as within our global network.

We are part of WPP, a large international group, and we work to combine the best of these two worlds. You are offered to work in a stimulating and developing workplace with a high comfort factor and colleagues who are close to laughing.

In addition to the obvious, such as good working conditions, pleasant working environment and exciting challenges, there are a couple of things that make working here a little extra good:


Great participation and opportunity to be involved and influence your daily work
Short decision-making paths and great closeness between management and employees
We think that a balance between work, leisure and personal development is important
Wellness allowance of SEK 3,000/year and several attractive staff benefits
We offer market-adapted pension terms and private pension advice via our partner Nordea
We have occupational health care via Feelgood and additional health insurance via Euro Accident
Conferences, kick-offs and other fun that we do together
Office centrally located in the middle of Stockholm city on Birger Jarlsgatan


Application

The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period. In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.

Contact

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Alexandra Lindh, Business Intelligence Engineer & Team Lead at alexandra.lindh@acceleration.biz. We do not accept applications via e-mail.

About GroupM

GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Acceleration. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.

Title: 🌟 IT Business Analyst/Kravanalytiker till Sogeti Stockholm🌟
Description:
Vi på Sogeti söker nu en driven och engagerad Business Analyst/Kravanalytiker med gedigen teknisk erfarenhet inom IT branschen som har fokus på att lösa komplexa affärsutmaningar. Om du trivs med skiftande utmaningar och är sugen på att göra skillnad hos våra kunder i exempelvis offentlig sektor, energisektor och bank- och finanssektor vill vi höra från dig!

Ansvarsområden: Samarbeta med olika intressenter för att samla in och analysera krav, för att säkerställa överensstämmelse med organisationens mål och branschpraxis.


Använda din tekniska kompetens för att bedöma genomförbarheten, prioritera, identifiera risker och föreslå innovativa lösningar.
Leda kravworkshops och underlätta diskussioner för att skapa konsensus bland tvärfunktionella team.
Översätta affärsbehov till detaljerade tekniska specifikationer och User stories, upprätthålla tydlig dokumentation under hela projektets livscykel.
Tillämpa din expertis inom bland annat offentlig-, energi- och och finanssektorerna för att skräddarsy lösningar som hanterar sektorspecifika utmaningar och efterlevnadskrav.
Använda agila metoder, främja iterativ utveckling, ständiga förbättringar och adaptiva planeringsmetoder. Kvalifikationer:
Kandidatexamen i datavetenskap, systemteknik eller liknande område. Avancerad examen föredras.
10 års dokumenterad erfarenhet som Business Analyst, Kravanalytiker, affärsanalytiker eller liknande roll inom offentlig-, energi- eller finanssektor.
Stark teknisk bakgrund med kunskaper inom exempelvis mjukvaruutvecklingsmetoder, dataanalys och systemarkitektur.
Visad förmåga att kommunicera komplexa lösningar effektivt till olika målgrupper, inklusive tekniska och icke-tekniska intressenter.

Title: Senior IT Business Analyst
Description:
Job ID: 25707

 

Are you passionate about finance and IT, and want to take the next step in your career? We are currently looking for a motivated and dynamic person to join our Capital Management Requirements & Analysis team at Nordea. In our team, we pride ourselves on engineering solutions and direct Nordea’s transformation by providing a holistic technological view and structured understanding of the bank, and its surrounding environment to enable the Customer Vision and the Business Strategy.

 

We are now looking for a Senior Business Analyst with solid experience from the banking industry that are eager to join us on our current journey of re-engineering our IT landscape within Capital reporting. You will play a crucial role in the project development lifecycle, and you will be allocated to one (or more) projects with a specific role in the execution structure.

 

We believe our new Senior Business Analyst loves working in cross-functional teams, have a passion for data analysis, data modelling and problem solving, and see their interpersonal communication as one of their strongest skills. If this sounds like you, and you are eager to learn and develop as a Business Analyst, it might be you who we're looking for!

 

About this opportunity

 

Meet the Capital Management Requirements & Analysis team. We work in Capital Management reporting and provide data for different reporting solutions, including Basel and Corep, and we specialize in IT analysis, data modelling, and data architecture. Our team is filled with international, diverse, and highly skilled professionals, working with a broad range of technology support that spans across the entire bank. The team is defined by a high work ethic and a strong mindset towards enabling high customer and user-oriented IT services. Collaboration, ownership, passion, and courage is therefore of utmost importance when joining this team, since these are the values that guide us in being, and performing, at our best.  

 

The team and this position is located in Stockholm, Sweden. This position might require travelling.

 

What you’ll be doing:

Take lead and drive requirements and analysis work that involves multiple stakeholders, ultimately to design sustainable and value adding solutions, this includes:
Elicit requirements (functional and non-functional) supported by established frameworks
Secure requirements traceability during end-to-end development
Be responsible for requirements documentation and provide know-how throughout the entire software delivery value stream
Build a contextual understanding of business processes on one hand and functional/technical know-how of our solutions on the other. This requires collaboration between business stakeholders and our developers and to support in building and prioritizing the product backlog
Perform End-to-end testing to verify that solution is working as expected
Support User acceptance testing performed by stakeholders

Who you are

 

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the four key values that guide us in being at our best. We imagine that you enjoy learning and are excited about bringing your ideas to the table. You’re dependable, willing to speak up – even when it’s difficult – and committed to empowering others.

We believe that you come from a solid background as a IT Business Analyst in the banking industry, with a thorough understanding of banking, Basel and similar regulations, as well as experience from pushing requirements and analysis work with multiple stakeholders. You probably have excellent communication skills and experience from (and loves) working in globally distributed teams.

 

To succeed in this role, we believe that you have:

Minimum 10 years of working experience in IT projects, whereas minimum 5 years working as IT Business Analyst
Solid background from banking industry and knowledge within credit risk domain more specifically regulatory reporting covering  following areas e.g. collaterals, risk exposure amount, reconciliations, guarantees, risk models
Ability to read and understand financial accounting data
Good experience in Data analysis using SQL queries
Experience from working with Python and/or Power BI
Configuring in SAP Business Warehouse and/or SAP Bank Analyzer (incl. SAP ABAP)
Knowledge in basic HANA queries is a plus
Experience working in Agile Software development, ideally SAFe framework
Full proficiency in spoken and written English

To be considered for this role, please be aware that you must have a valid Swedish permanent work permit or a European / Swedish citizenship.

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

 

We kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible, but no later than 06/10/2024. We will ongoingly be reviewing applications and conducting interviews as we receive them, and might close the recruitment process before the posting end date. Therefore, we ask you to submit your application as soon as possible. Any applications or CVs sent by email, direct messages, or any other channel than our application forms, will not be accepted or considered.

 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics, and traits make us better at serving our customers and communities.

 

If you have any questions about our recruitment process, please reach out to our tech recruiter and main point of contact anna.dahlstrom@consult.nordea.com.

 

Only for candidates in Sweden: for union information, please contact Finansförbundet at finansforbundet@nordea.com or SACO at SacoNordea@nordea.com.
